{"step_by_step_thinking": "The highest risk associated with the use of oral contraceptives is in thromboembolic disorders. Oral contraceptives contain hormones that can increase the risk of blood clots forming in the veins, which can lead to thromboembolic disorders such as deep vein thrombosis (DVT) or pulmonary embolism (PE). While other risks such as hepatic necrosis, permanent sterility, and breast cancer are possible side effects of oral contraceptives, the risk of thromboembolic disorders is considered to be the highest.", "answer_choice": "C. Thromboembolic disorders"}
